oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Archibald Yell
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photograph of a portrait painting of Archibald Yell (1797-1847) with hand on chair, wearing masonic attire. Copy work by Rodney Poole.

Grand Master of the Knights Templar, 1831. Governor of Arkansas, 1840-1844. Killed at Buena Vista during the Mexican War.

Rodney Poole bought J. H. Van Stavoren's photography studio at a chancery court sale in 1871. As an active Mason, Poole was given permission to photograph the portraits of past Grand Masters ("Daily American," 11/14/1878, p.4). The Calverts bought Poole's photography studio in 1896.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Yell, Archibald
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Poole, Rodney, 1837-1921
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Calvert Brothers Studio Glass Plate Negatives
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Politicians; Garments; Apparel; Men's clothing; Medallions; Medals; Freemasonry; Masonic orders; Regalia
Governors; Soldiers; Fraternal organizations
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Box 86; Copy print in Library Photograph Collection, Drawer 26, Folder 228
